definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: He discarded an old hat and an old pair of shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他扔掉了一顶旧帽子和一双旧鞋。

sentences.english: Every Saturday since then, I have taken one marble out and thrown it away.
sentences.chinese: 从那时起，每到星期六，我都拿出一个弹珠扔掉。

sentences.english: Such wonders should not be thrown away like this.
sentences.chinese: 这样奇妙的东西不应该像这样的被扔掉。

sentences.english: I have done away with my Bloglines account.
sentences.chinese: 我已经扔掉了自己在线阅读器的帐号。

sentences.english: Get the carrot, onion and garlic from the broth out and throw them out.
sentences.chinese: 把胡萝卜，葱和蒜从肉汤里取出来扔掉。

sentences.english: Instead of looking at leaves as something to rake, think of them as potential fun.
sentences.chinese: 与其把树叶扫走扔掉，不如找找它潜在的乐趣。

sentences.english: If one experiment doesn’t work you throw it away and try something else.
sentences.chinese: 如果一种试验没有成功，扔掉它，再试试别的吧。

sentences.english: The novel I had thrown away was chosen by the Book Society.
sentences.chinese: 我一度扔掉的那部小说后来被书社选中了。

sentences.english: He threw his hoe away and lay by the tree every day, dreaming for more rabbits to come.
sentences.chinese: 他扔掉锄头，每天躺在树边，梦想有兔子来。

sentences.english: They rejected the apples that were overripe.
sentences.chinese: 他们把那些熟得过透的苹果扔掉。

sentences.english: You had better not throw layers and outer leaves which are hard to chew.
sentences.chinese: 最好不要扔掉有嚼头的皮和外层叶子。

sentences.english: Rabbit threw away a little table that wiggled .
sentences.chinese: 家兔扔掉了一张摇摇晃晃的小桌子。

sentences.english: At the Evian bottle facility in Evian, France, almost nothing is thrown away.
sentences.chinese: 在埃维昂一瓶设施在法国埃维昂，几乎没有扔掉。

sentences.english: Toss those papers out, they are useless.
sentences.chinese: 把那些证明文件扔掉吧，没用了。

sentences.english: Listen to the experts, but be prepared to throw away the guidebooks
sentences.chinese: 听专家的意见，但作好扔掉指导书的准备。

sentences.english: Don’t throw away your old PC.

definition: to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
to give away/to accompany/to see sb off

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
conveniently/without extra trouble/while doing it/in passing
